comments.author: Justine Claret-Tournier

comments.text:
Ok...
I have a few things I want to say about this video and some of the 
responses. And I want to make sure that I get it all out. 

1. I want to say Big Ups to BigHit Entertainment. You all continue to 
astound us with the artists that you put out. "Cough..Cough...BTS" 

2. This video was made over the summer but I just saw it pop up in my 
Youtube feed this morning. Took a look at it and I love it! The song is 
catchy. The artist have really nice voices and TA DA.....They used a model 
of color in the video. Finally something other than just Russian models!

That being said, damn near every time I see a Korean artist using a black 
woman in a video, I always see some fangirls, who I can only assume may be 
asian...I could be wrong...... whose brains have just exploded, start 
making negative comments. The most common one is...." black models in 
Korean videos are always portrayed as the ho..."

Excuse me?????

The girls in the BTS video that they did as an assignment on their American 
Life series were not portrayed as hoes. The black women in Rain's La video 
were not portrayed as hoes. And the woman in this video was not portrayed 
as a hoe either. 

So what exactly are you really trying to say? It's ok for us to like the 
videos, buy the merchandise and support the artist but we better not ever 
think we can be portrayed positively in any of their videos? 

The fuck out of here with that Bullshit!!!

Ya'll need to get over yourselves, grow the fuck up and understand.....Kpop 
is no longer just a Korean or Asian thing. It's an international movement. 
It has no boundaries. Music has no boundaries. Hell, pretty soon we'll 
probably be seeing some of our Latina or Indian sisters in videos. 

Now, when they do their live shows at home, that's a different story. I 
understand they have to go with whatever the network will allow. That's sad 
but it's to be expected. But hurry up and believe, I for one will not sit 
back and let anyone label all of us as hoes just because of your limited 
exposure to our culture. 

There. That's my two cents.

Love you BigHit. Keep em coming.....

+PsychoMalkavian42 +Alisha Bacon +Helen V +Chris Sol88Sun +Chantal Espinosa 
+M Smith +Ms. Mik +Nancy V.I.P Nonocasper 낸시 +Angel Eyes +Eyxaful +Cassandra 
카산드라 +rose melody +Mary Revette ﻿
comments.author: Cassandra Reid

comments.text: True

matter what color of skin you are… you just feel the music and enjoy it. If 
they can't accept that then this is not for them to do so. There is nothing 
wrong with having other races besides asian to be in music videos. Oh but 
as long they are FAIR skined it acceptable. Get out of here with that BS! 
Moving on…… ﻿ignorance will not get them any where. Thank you BigHit and 
JYP entertainment.

comments.text:
#Kpop   #Talk  

Chelsea's Album Pick of the Week - 
http://i.instagram.com/p/s2od9srldB/?modal=true

Pour Les Femmes by Homme

Homme is a Korean duo consisting of the main vocalists from 2AM and 8eight, 
namely Chang Min, and Lee Hyeon. Pour Les Femmes is their first album as a 
duet.

Homme has a unique Contemporary Jazz sound that's just awesome. The blend 
of their voices is perfect.

A couple of their songs carry a feel of what can be considered a fusion 
between Pharrel, Robin Thicke, and Andre 3000. And then there's 니가 그리올 리없어, 
a definite favourite, which lends itself to the Brooklyn-style Sunday-choir 
sound.﻿

comments.text:
2AM was under BigHit before and their contract with BigHit has already 
ended on March. JoKwon, Seulong and Jinwoon are now returned to JYP and 
only Changmin is not.  Changmin now is still under BigHit due to some 
schedules left under BigHit. Changmin decided to stay in BigHit because he 
wants to make everything smooth and it will not affect the activities as 
group. :) Don't worry! XD Hope this helps!

comments.text:

comments.author: Patricia Aubin

comments.text:
+Patricia Aubin I'm so glad that you have the same opinion as me. :) Man 
Should Laugh and I Was Able To Eat Well were so popular that time when they 
just formed Homme. Now they are back with It Girl. It's something new and 
fresh which is a good thing. But I want to see like what they did 
previously. Yup.! People are focusing more on Kyungri than enjoying Homme's 
hard work. This saddens me. I'm not against Kyungri. I mean people should 
really focus on Homme and enjoy their music instead of commenting about 
Kyungri.
comments.author: nlm IAM

comments.text:
+nlm IAM I was so happy when Lee Hyun finished his military service! But I 
have to agree with you.. their album was really rushed.. I just loved so 
much Man should laugh! But now with Kyungri, people are more focusing on 
her than enjoying Homme's hard work! Tsk tsk..
comments.author: Patricia Aubin

comments.text:
+Patricia Aubin Me too! It's been 3 years since they released Man Should 
Laugh. Now both of them have finished their military service. I'm hoping 
more comebacks form them! XD It's because I feel like this mini album is a 
rush for them. This album is released 2 weeks after Lee Hyun discharged 
from army which is so quick!! So, I want them to have more time to prepare 
the next album. Hehe XD
comments.author: nlm IAM
